intro: Ludekia bernardoi, commonly known as the Bernard's ludekia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Ludekia bernardoi is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
